intro: Machilus grandibracteatus, commonly known as the large bract machilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and have a distinctive elliptical shape with a smooth margin. The fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
